**Install, set your PIN and forget**

How to test the power of Mobile Police

Step 1: Goto the Save Pin page and set a PIN for youself

Step 2: Set your phone on silent mode

Step 3: Open your SMS application and send yourself the message (case sensitive):

	MPREQ <your PIN> RING

Step 4: When your SMS is received the phone rings at full volume.

Scroll down to check out more exiting features.

MOBILE POLICE

Mobile Police is primarily an SMS based remote phone management application. The application allows you to remotely control certain important aspects of your phone like Call Forwarding, Reporting of Phone Location, Making a call, finding a misplaced phone on silent mode etc. The app also give you local features like archival of SMS messages and Phone Contacts into an Excel Spreadsheet.

 PIN AUTHENTICATION

A secret pin is an authentication feature to make sure that only remote operation requests with a valid PIN are processed. During first use set the PIN in the Save PIN page, subsequently the PIN can be changed on providing the old PIN. For security consideration PIN cannot be reset or recovered, so DO NOT forget or mistype your PIN. The remote control features won't work without setting a PIN.

REMOTE CONTROL FEATURES

Once you Set the PIN, by default all remote control features are enabled. Specific features can be turned on/off from the settings page.
You can initiate remote control in two ways, by using the Mobile Police App installed in another phone, or by sending a request SMS to your phone as mentioned below.

NOTE: The SMS format is case sensitive

START CALL FORWARDING
MPREQ <your PIN> STARTFWD <forward-to-number>
Eg: MPREQ 1234 STARTFWD 9996669990

STOP CALL FORWARDING
MPREQ <your PIN> STOPFWD
Eg: MPREQ 1234 STOPFWD

MAKE A CALL
MPREQ <your PIN> CALL <number-to-call>
Eg: MPREQ 1234 CALL 9996669990

PLAY RINGTONE
MPREQ <your PIN> RING
Eg: MPREQ 1234 RING

LOCATE PHONE
MPREQ <your PIN> LOCATE
Eg: MPREQ 1234 LOCATE


LOCAL FEATURES

EXPORT CONTACTS: In the export contacts page you can get your phone contacts in an Excel Spreadsheet. You can use this as a backup or an initial data source for synchronizing contacts into other non-google services. Once export is done, contacts.xls can be found on your sdcard root.

EXPORT SMS: In the export SMS page you can save your SMS in an Excel Spreadsheet to preserve your message history. Once export is done, sms.xls can be found on your sdcard root.
